intro: Markhamia zanzibarica, commonly known as Zanzibar lily, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of East Africa. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming dense clumps with strap-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens in tropical and subtropical climates. Its ornamental value is further enhanced by its fragrant blooms and ability to bloom throughout the year under suitable conditions.
